bibl.title: Despatch from Robert Lyrett, March 31, 1874
Despatches from United States Consuls in Boma, 1888-1895
bibl.publisher: National Archives and Records Service General Services Administration

correspAction.roleName: Acting Clerk of the Legislative Consul

div1.p: Gambia----1874 In the thirty seventh year of the right of Her Majesty Queen Victoria 31st March 1874
An Ordinance to alter the Tonnage dues for the Port of Bathurst, and healthy certain exemptions from Port charges.
Whereas it is unnecessary to alter the Tonnage dues on vessels entering the River Gambia, and to exempt H.M. Transports and Marl Governor from port charges.
Be it therefore enacted by the the Administration and Legislative Council of the settlements on the River Gambia as follows as:
1st From and after the of this Ordinance the dujty of two shillings per ton register measurement was payable once in the year on ships, boats, a vessels entering the River Gambia shall ease and

determine, and there shall be buuried in brew thereof on ll such ships, boats, or vessels, a duty of One shilling and per register we document each that any such ships, boat or vessel shall so enter the River Gambia 2nd It shall be lonefful to admit A. M. Transports and Steam Vessels-- carrying Her Majesty's Mails under arrangement with the Postmaster General or with the Colonial Government of the settlement on the Gambia free of any or all Port charges. C.H.Kentbright administration

Passed in the legislature Council this Thirty first day of March in the year of Our Lord One thousand, eight hundred and seventy four.
Robert H. Lyrett Acting Clerk od the Legislative Council
